qas.question: What was the name of the non-subscription Xbox online gaming service?
What was the "color" name given to the premium version of Xbox Live?
What key feature is not supported by the free version of Live?
Which popular gaming titles have their own online service outside Xbox Live?
Voice support came online with what feature addition?
What was Xbox Live Free renamed as?
What color is associated with Xbox Live Arcade?
How long was voice support down after its launch?
What is an example of a game that does not support multiplayer online?
What game with its own subscription service cannot be played using Live Free?

context: When the Xbox 360 was released, Microsoft's online gaming service Xbox Live was shut down for <b7_0>24 hours<b7_0/> and underwent a major upgrade, adding a basic non-subscription service called <a0_0><b5_0>Xbox Live Silver<b5_0/><a0_0/> (later renamed Xbox Live Free) to its already established premium subscription-based service (which was renamed <a1_0><b6_0>Gold<b6_0/><a1_0/>). Xbox Live Free is included with all SKUs of the console. It allows users to create a user profile, join on message boards, and access Microsoft's Xbox Live Arcade and Marketplace and talk to other members. A Live Free account does not generally support <a2_0>multiplayer gaming<a2_0/>; however, some games that have rather limited online functions already, (such as <b8_0>Viva Piñata<b8_0/>) or games that feature their own subscription service (e.g. <a3_0><b9_0>EA Sports<b9_0/> games<a3_0/>) can be played with a Free account. Xbox Live also supports voice the latter a feature possible with the <a4_0>Xbox Live Vision<a4_0/>.
